description: A queue is a First-In-First-Out (FIFO) data structure supporting enqueue and dequeue operations.

examples.basic:
from collections import deque
q = deque()
q.append(1)    # enqueue
q.append(2)
val = q.popleft()  # dequeue

q := []int{}
q = append(q, 1)   // enqueue
q = append(q, 2)
val := q[0]        // dequeue
q = q[1:]
examples.realworld:
var jobs []Job
jobs = append(jobs, j)
next := jobs[0]
jobs = jobs[1:]
